Judul: INVESTMENT ANALYSIS OF EXPANSION PLAN PT BASUKI PRATAMA ENGINEERING
Abstrak:
PT Basuki Pratama Engineering is engaged in the business of construction, manufacture of boilers, and any others. By the fact of increasing energy demand, the variety of boiler capacity demand also increasing. As the demand of PT Basuki Pratama Engineering (BPE) is also increasing with the long Ã‚Â– term contract and larger capacity of boiler, it pushes the company to have a larger capacity to produce. The current capacity does not meet the demand since the workshop of the company does not allow the company to make a boiler with a larger capacity. To be able to meet the market demand, the company needs to expand the workshop, in order to create boiler in many capacity variety. And also, to increase sales and profit, PT Basuki Pratama Engineering (BPE) needs to expand their business. So, the company can manufacture more boilers and produce more products with the new machines, workshop, and equipment  
 

To expand their business, the company had planned to increase their capital with building new workshop that can build larger boiler capacity. The company already allocated IDR 42 billion in to build new workshop. The management wants to know whether this investment is profitable or not for the company.  
 

After assess the cash flow with capital budgeting technique, the recommendation for the companyÃ‚Â’s management is to continue to expand their workshop project in order to realizing company goals to fulfill the demand and get more revenue. From the investment calculation analysis, it turns out in optimistic, base, and pessimistic scenario that all schemes generated a positive NPV. The IRR for those three scenarios are also greater than WACC (9.16%). From Profitability Index (PI), those three scenarios generated PI greater than 1.00. For the discounted payback period those three scenarios also lower than the companyÃ‚Â’s limit within 10 years. So, the project is still feasible even the company experience a bad condition or performance.
Kata Kunci: capital budgeting, operating cash flow, NPV, IRR, Payback Period, Profitability Index
